intro: Erodium cicutarium subsp. pimpinellifolium, commonly known as the common velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive velvety texture. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom from spring to early summer. Its seeds are encased in a hairy, triangular capsule, which aids in seed dispersal. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
